body_html:
@nbro A simple way to use tf_upgrade.py is to go to directory tree then replace
from tensorflow.tools.compatibility import ast_edits with
import ast_edits

Type this in the command line:
python tf_upgrade.py --infile renames_v2.py --outfile foo-upgraded.py
body_text:
@nbro A simple way to use tf_upgrade.py is to go to directory tree then replace
from tensorflow.tools.compatibility import ast_edits with
import ast_edits
Type this in the command line:
python tf_upgrade.py --infile renames_v2.py --outfile foo-upgraded.py
body:
@nbro A simple way to use tf_upgrade.py is to go to directory tree then replace 
`from tensorflow.tools.compatibility import ast_edits` with
`import ast_edits`

Type this in the command line:
`python tf_upgrade.py --infile renames_v2.py --outfile foo-upgraded.py`
